intro: Echium portosanctense, commonly known as the Porto Santo thistle, is a flowering plant native to the island of Porto Santo in the archipelago of Madeira, Portugal. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, coastal areas and is adapted to the harsh maritime climate of its native habitat. It produces distinctive, spiny leaves and has a short, upright stem. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
